channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Who will be left to cover the troops as the Pentagon limits journalists' access?
item.description: Smaller publications that cover the Pentagon are likely to be the most affected by a new press policy put into place by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.

item.title: Trump's approach to cartels mirrors the global war on terror, officials say
item.description: The administration's approach to drug cartels relies — at least in part — on a blueprint for military strikes that mirror those waged during the war on terrorism after the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.

item.title: A rabbi reflects on her Yom Kippur message, as Israel's war in Gaza continues
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Rabbi Sharon Brous of IKAR, a congregation in Los Angeles, about her message this year during the Yom Kippur holiday.

item.title: What Trump and Hegseth told top military commanders in unusual Quantico gathering
item.description: President Trump defended the use of troops in U.S. cities while Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth told military commanders about new physical fitness and grooming requirements for uniformed personnel.

item.title: Will Hamas accept Trump's peace plan? Former Mossad chief says it should
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks to former Mossad chief Yossi Cohen about his new book, The Sword of Freedom: Israel, Mossad, and the Secret War.

item.title: As sports betting explodes, experts push for a public health approach to addiction
item.description: Sports betting is now legal in 39 and D.C. But public health experts are concerned about gambling disorders, and are calling for more limits on sports gambling to prevent addiction.

item.title: Newt Gingrich thinks Democrats 'don't have what it takes' to win shutdown
item.description: A government shutdown is looming as Republicans and Democrats continue to search for middle ground on a variety of issues. Newt Gingrich shares his perspective on this most recent shutdown fight.

item.title: Sen. Duckworth on Hegseth's Quantico speech
item.description: President Trump defended the use of troops in U.S. cities while Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth told military commanders about new physical fitness and grooming requirements for uniformed personnel.

item.title: Lasers provide some bird flu protection for turkey producers in Minnesota
item.description: Migrating birds can be a pleasant seasonal sight, but they're a bird flu threat to turkey farmers. In Minnesota, some are using lasers to scare them away.

item.title: DOJ sues eight states for voting data
item.description: The Justice Department is making unprecedented demands for state elections data.
